answers.answer: Hi.  I have been having burning in my legs for about 6 weeks. It seemed to start as tingling shortly after a course of cipro.  I am going to a rheumy and a neuro next week.  I'm really scared.  I guess it is probably a small fiber neuropathy and every time I look up causes of that I get scared.  I don't have diabetes or STD's.  I'm sure that I will need to go for tons of tests again.Sometimes the burning seems to be worse when sitting or when my clothes rub my skin.  Also, sometimes being really warm, like when I am under the covers at night seems to bother me.If you find anything out, please let me know.  I will let you know if I get any info also.Good luck

Sure thing man.  I personally just want it to go away.  For me personally I love being under my blankets.  It seems to go away when im relaxed and warm.  When in my car I have the heater towards my feet and the warmth makes me forget I have it.  The coldness definitely makes it worse.  I notice when I work out it seems to go away...im not really sure if this is mental or I litterally have a skin condition.  I'll let you know how things go.  Good luck with you too.

Hi,I think you are having Peripheral neuropathy (PN).Peripheral neuropathy refers to a peripheral nerve disorder of any cause. Nerve involvement may be single (mono-neuropathy) or multiple (poly-neuropathy); pathology may be axonal or demyelinating.Lower back strain and nerve entrapment at the exit from the spine can cause similar symptoms.I appreciate your idea of meeting neurologist. I think you should be asking for imaging study of lower back and electro-diagnostic studies as well.Keep me informed.Bye.

Thanks for the ideas.  I did hurt my mid back and possibly my lower back late last summer on a four-wheeler.  I hit an unexpected bump while in the process of returning to a sitting position from a standing position.  I felt a surge though my entire spine like I jammed it.  I was having back pain for months.  My dr. didn't seem to care so I blew it off and probably shouldn't have.  Also, I have had an mri of my neck showing degenerative arthritis and all dics buldging.  I am 29 years old.I have been seeing a chiro.  Could this be causing more harm than good? I have noticed that when he tries to pop my lower back I get an itching sensation that spreads out from my spine.  Sometimes I get then this when bending over also.  Could it be related?Thanks again for you post.  I am a very anxious person and talking about it seems to help.  This forum has been a comfort to me.I will let you know how it goes.

Hi.  I just wanted to update you on my situation as promised.  I had an emg that came back normal and bloodwork for inflammatory markers, lyme and vitamin deficiencies.  Along with an MRI of my brain w/ and w/out contrast.  All came back normal.  My neuro said I am healthy.  My skin burning has decreased.  My neuro said that he thinks it had to do with nerve ending inflammation due to long distance running.  I don't buy it.  I seem to notice that if I take ibuprophen or certian antibiotics it flares up again.  I think it may be a reaction.  I still have alot of anxiety about it but I am trying to cope.  I also get twitches (which I have had my whole life) and the neuro said this was normal.  Currently, I have had a buzzing sensation in my hand for about 2 - 3 weeks.  The neuro said that although this is abnormal, given my work up it is not serious.Icicles, how are you doing?  JainMD, any advice?Thanks,Turtle

question: Im visiting an allergist soon, but I have prolonged burning feelings on my legs and sometimes my chest.  All of this began after having sexual relations with a past partner.  I had these feelings for nearly two years and they just went away.  For 5 months it was gone this late 2007, but I recently had sexual relations with a new partner. For the 5 months that it was gone, I ate, drank, and did whatever without thinking since perhaps I have sensitive skin, maybe I shouldn't swim or eat this or drink that.   STD checks came back negative and I show no visible symptoms.Some people told me to check to see if I have Diabetes or some form of NueroPathy that is affecting my nerves.  The burning is about a 4-5/10 and it varies depending on creams I use.  Just wondering what to make of all this since its something I never had before and it is quite a nuisance to have. Thanks.
